name: Saint Joan of Arc
description: Saint Joan of Arc was a French heroine who led armies during the Hundred Years' War and was later canonized for her faith and courage.

name: Saint Anthony of Padua
description: Saint Anthony of Padua was a Franciscan priest known for his powerful preaching and is the patron saint of lost items.

name: Saint Maximilian Kolbe
description: Saint Maximilian Kolbe was a Polish priest who gave his life in place of another prisoner at Auschwitz during World War II.

name: Saint Gregory the Great
description: Saint Gregory I, also known as Gregory the Great, was pope and a Doctor of the Church, known for his reforms and writings.

name: Saint Kateri Tekakwitha
description: Saint Kateri Tekakwitha was the first Native American to be canonized, known for her piety and devotion.

name: Saint Polycarp
description: Saint Polycarp was a 2nd-century bishop of Smyrna and martyr, one of the Apostolic Fathers.

name: Saint Cecilia
description: Saint Cecilia is the patron saint of music and musicians, remembered for her faith and martyrdom.

name: Saint Jerome
description: Saint Jerome was a biblical scholar who translated the Bible into Latin (the Vulgate).

name: Saint Ambrose
description: Saint Ambrose was bishop of Milan and one of the four original Doctors of the Church.

name: Saint Scholastica
description: Saint Scholastica was the twin sister of Saint Benedict and founded a women's monastic community.

name: Saint Isidore the Farmer
description: Saint Isidore was a Spanish farmer known for his piety, humility, and miracles related to agriculture.

name: Saint Blaise
description: Saint Blaise was a bishop and martyr, best known for his protection against throat ailments.

name: Saint Lucy
description: Saint Lucy was a Christian martyr and is the patron saint of the blind and those with eye problems.

name: Saint Martin of Tours
description: Saint Martin was a Roman soldier turned bishop known for his charity and humility.

name: Saint John the Baptist
description: Saint John the Baptist was the forerunner of Christ and baptized Jesus in the Jordan River.

name: Saint John Bosco
description: Saint John Bosco was a priest who dedicated his life to educating and caring for disadvantaged youth.

name: Saint Dominic
description: Saint Dominic was the founder of the Dominican Order, dedicated to preaching and teaching.

name: Saint Jerome Emiliani
description: Saint Jerome Emiliani is the patron saint of orphans and abandoned children.

name: Saint Rose of Lima
description: Saint Rose of Lima was the first person born in the Americas to be canonized, known for her life of prayer and penance.

name: Saint Lawrence
description: Saint Lawrence was a Roman deacon and martyr who distributed alms to the poor.

name: Saint John of the Cross
description: Saint John of the Cross was a Carmelite friar, mystic, and Doctor of the Church, known for his writings on the spiritual life.

name: Saint Teresa of Ávila
description: Saint Teresa was a Carmelite reformer and mystic, and one of the first women to be named a Doctor of the Church.

name: Saint John the Evangelist
description: Saint John the Evangelist was one of the Twelve Apostles and is traditionally credited with the Gospel of John and Revelation.

name: Saint Peter
description: Saint Peter was one of the Twelve Apostles and the first pope, known for his leadership and martyrdom.

name: Saint Paul
description: Saint Paul was a former persecutor of Christians who became one of Christianity's greatest missionaries and writers.

name: Saint Anthony the Great
description: Saint Anthony the Great was a Christian monk from Egypt and is considered the father of monasticism.

name: Saint Catherine Labouré
description: Saint Catherine Labouré received the visions of the Miraculous Medal from the Virgin Mary.

name: Saint Maria Goretti
description: Saint Maria Goretti is one of the youngest canonized saints and is known for her purity and forgiveness of her attacker.

name: Saint Juan Diego
description: Saint Juan Diego was the indigenous man who witnessed the apparition of Our Lady of Guadalupe in Mexico.

name: Saint Ephrem the Syrian
description: Saint Ephrem was a deacon and poet-theologian of the early Church, revered for his hymns and writings.
